svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
November 20, 2021" date: "2021-11-20"
Eth News and Links
Mainnet execution layer
* Trent: miners should plan for PoW to end in 3-6 months
* PoW switch off second community call December 3, for infrastructure providers,
wallet and application developers
* Erigon v2021.11.03 : bug fixes, continuing to stabilize beta
* Erigon reduced scope of v2 : stopping work on consensus engine separation as PoS
testnets can replace PoW and PoA testnets
* Nimbus creating an execution layer client , so that when we turn off proof of work
you can run Nimbus for execution and consensus layers
* Piper Merriam’s Aperture Portal Network update , focused on getting a live testnet
EIPs/Standards
* EIP NFTs : authors of finalized EIPs can mint an NFT
Proof of Stake consensus layer
* Latest What’s New in Eth2 (or What’s New in Consensus Layer if you prefer, thanks to
Proto, but please open both)
* PoS implementers call . Notes from Ben Edgington : multi-client devnet started,
discussion on total transition difficulty (TTD) override
* Vitalik: Casper FFG with backoff
Layer2
* Celer cBridge v2.0 live on mainnet, one click user experience and LPs don’t need to
run a cBridge node
* StarkNet Alpha 4 (release candidate for mainnet): adds token bridges, block hash,
self contract address & updates contract address calculation
* Polygon Miden : zk virtual machine in Rust for STARK based zk rollup, led by Bobbin
Threadbare (former Facebook's lead ZK researcher & creator of Winterfell), alpha
* Binance adds direct deposit to Arbitrum One rollup with withdrawals to be added
later
This newsletter is made possible thanks to Starbloom Ventures !
Starbloom Ventures is a new early-stage venture fund by Evan Van Ness and James Fickel
to invest in the future of web3.
Check out our announcement tweetstorm .
We’re pledging 10% of profits to support Ethereum public goods.
Stuff for developers
* Annual Solidity developer survey [Google form]
* web3.js v1.6.1 : breaking change in web3.eth.getBlock output, open discussion on
auto fill of gas price if not set in sendTransaction
* eth-sdk v0.2.2 (generate type-safe contract SDK via the address): option to use
Sourcify as ABI source
* Uniswap v3 geometric mean TWAP oracle manipulation , technically possible but under
restrictive conditions
* OpenZeppelin Defender contract automation, now free for teams
* Gelato Ops : contract task automation
* MultiFaucet : Ropsten, Kovan, Görli and Optimism Kovan testnet faucet via Twitter
sign in, dripping ETH, wETH, DAI and ERC721 NFTs
* siwe : Sign-In with Ethereum library, alpha with example integration
Security
* ERC1155Supply low severity OpenZeppelin Contracts vulnerability, total supply lower
than circulating tokens during callback when minting
* Using Flashbots to recover ENS tokens from a compromised mnemonic
Ecosystem
* watchtheburn v3 : insights with real-time historical totals, basefee increasing and
net issuance decreasing every month
* Galaxy Digital: visualization for 100 days of EIP1559 [PDF], miner revenue increased
33% in dollar terms, 56% of ETH issuance burnt
* Vitalik’s review of Optimism’s retroactive public goods funding round: increase
number & diversity of voters, 2 layer nomination process, secret ballots, more
discussion and change reward formula
* Flashbots Protect : view status of pending transactions on Etherscan
Enterprise
* TIME magazine to hold ETH on balance sheet
* Sotheby’s live auction denominated in Ether for two Banksy paintings
* Adidas issued POAP via their mobile app
* Yuga Labs (creators of Bored Apes) trademark application for APE with US Patent &
Trademark Office
Application layer
* Aave Arc : permissioned Aave market with Fireblocks providing KYC/AML and onboarding
to institutions
* Cream Finance exploit recovery, allocating tokens from the treasury to impacted,
uninsured users
* Paraswap governance token , ~20k users eligible to claim out of more than 1 million
addresses
* Saddle governance token , initially non-transferrable, after 3 months DAO can make
transferrable or after 12 months anyone can
* AugurDAO : plan for transition to DAO using a DXdao Guild
* ConstitutionDAO : attempt to buy print of US constitution, outbid at auction by Ken
Griffin for $41 million (plus fees & taxes), contributors can claim a pro rata refund
and a POAP [Disclosure: I contributed]
Job Listings
* ethereum.org team is hiring a Product Designer
* Open Source Developer at OpenZeppelin
* Ethereum Foundation hiring a Research Engineer for PoS consensus layer
Reach people experienced with Ethereum. $420 for two issues (~75 character limit),
payable in ETH/DAI/USDC to abcoathup.eth. Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
* Ethereum Foundation grants to Coin Center, Electronic Frontier Foundation, Fight for
the Future and upcoming Gitcoin advocacy round
* Fei and Rari token merger proposal
* Analysis of COMP liquidity miners participation in governance , 7% hold 50% or more
of the COMP they claimed, only 1 in top 100 ever voted
General
* Crypto.com buys 20 year naming rights for Staples Center in LA
* npm vulnerability , attacker could publish a new version of any package
* Amazon UK in 2022 will no longer accept payments from UK issued Visa credit cards
due to interchange fee of 1.5%
* Jameson Lopp: Four year journey tracking down a swatter
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow
@evan_van_ness and @abcoathup to get most of the week’s news in real time.
Permalink for this week’s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-november-20-2021
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note (new/changes in bold ) :
* Oct 25 - Dec 13 – Gitcoin DAO Global hackathon (virtual)
* Dec 1-16 – Gitcoin Grants Round 12
* Dec 3 – PoW switch off second community call
* Dec ~8 – Arrow Glacier upgrade block 13,773,000
* Jan 24-26 – Science of Blockchain Conference (Stanford University)
* Feb 11-20 – ETHDenver
* Mar 28-30 – ETHDubai
Did you get forwarded this newsletter? Sign up to receive it weekly
Week in Ethereum News
